intro: Gilia nuttallii var. floribunda, commonly known as the showy gilia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the evening primrose family (Onagraceae) and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that typically bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant produces clusters of bright red or orange flowers with five petals, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in dry slopes and rocky habitats. Gilia nuttallii var. floribunda is an herbaceous annual or biennial plant with slender, branched stems and small, lance-shaped leaves.
